docs.lead_paragraph: The schooner S. Morris Waln, from Pernambuco 17th ult., arrived this afternoon. The captain reports that on the 10th January, lat. 30[degrees] north, long. 29[degrees] west, on the outward passage, he was brought to by a black, topsail schooner, and boarded by a boat's crew, armed with pistols and dirks.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Sussex (N. J.) Register notices the decease of a venerable citizen of that County in the person of BENJAMIN HALSEY, Esq. He was a native of Morris County, born in April, 1764. For some ten years, he had a place in the local magistracy; and for the last thirty years was a ruling elder in the First Presbyterian Church at Newton.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Cunard steamship Canada reached Hal-fax yesterday afternoon. A brief synopsis of her news is published elsewhere. The Commercial advices by this arrival are not encouraging. Cotton and Breadstuffs were both dull and declining. The latest date from Liverpool is the 5th inst., but the failure of the wires leaves us without an intimation as to the importance of the news.

headline.main: FROM ASPINWALL AND HAVANA.; Arrival of the Ohio and Black Warrior. $2,445,000 IN GOLD.

docs.lead_paragraph: The U. S. Mail steamship Ohio, Capt. HART STEINE, arrived yesterday from Aspinwall and Havana, bringing the California mails and the shipment of gold dust, amounting to $2,445,000. Her news from the Isthmus and California is anticipated.
docs.snippet: The U. S. Mail steamship Ohio, Capt. HART STEINE, arrived yesterday from Aspinwall and Havana, bringing the California mails and the shipment of gold dust, amounting to $2,445,000. Her news from the Isthmus and California is anticipated.

docs.lead_paragraph: We are indebted to the politeness of the City Inspector for a copy of his Annual Report of the number of deaths and interments in the City of New-York during the year 1852. It is a document of more than 300 pages, and, of course, is not destitute of valuable statistical information.

docs.lead_paragraph: Must he not be a bold man who would dare may a word in favor of an article so much used and so much condemned ? So much condemned, indeed, that if precept could only serve instead of practice, the weed would be unknown. " My son," says a sage father, " hand me a light for this cigar." He lights and begins smoking. " I hope you will never acquire the habit.

docs.lead_paragraph: Whoever has visited the American coal-mining districts can hardly have failed to notice the unpromising condition of the houses provided for the accommodation of the miners. Mere shanties, loosely constructed, are generally deemed sufficient to supply their wants.

docs.lead_paragraph: The question arises some time or other in the mind of every man as to the best means of disposing of that corporeal skin which falls like a cerement when the chrysalis bursts and the Psyche soars into the sunshine of the eternal.
